name: NIS 2
fullName: Network and Information Security Directive 2 (EU Directive 2022/2555)
governingBody: European Parliament and Council of the European Union
primaryAudience: Essential Entities (energy, transport, health, digital infrastructure)
Important Entities (postal services, waste management, food, manufacturing, digital providers)
description: NIS 2 dramatically expands the scope of EU cybersecurity regulation from the original NIS Directive. It covers 18 critical sectors, introduces management liability, and mandates specific cybersecurity risk management measures (Article 21). It establishes a multi-million euro fine regime modeled on GDPR.

certificationDetails.assessor: National competent authorities; periodic audits and inspections
certificationDetails.auditCycle: Ongoing compliance; supervisory reviews and audits

lifecycle.name: Scoping and Classification
lifecycle.description: Determine if the entity falls under NIS 2 as essential or important. Register with relevant national authority.

lifecycle.name: Risk Assessment
lifecycle.description: Conduct comprehensive risk assessment covering all Article 21 measures.

lifecycle.name: Implementation of Measures
lifecycle.description: Implement all 10 cybersecurity risk management measures defined in Article 21(2).

lifecycle.name: Ongoing Compliance
lifecycle.description: Maintain compliance through monitoring, incident reporting, and continuous improvement.

domains.name: Cybersecurity Risk Management Measures (Article 21)
domains.description: Ten specific cybersecurity risk management measures that entities must implement. These are the core operational requirements of NIS 2.

controls.name: Risk Analysis and Information System Security Policies
controls.description: Implement policies on risk analysis and information system security.
controls.implementationGuidance: Develop comprehensive information security policies. Conduct regular risk analyses. Document security objectives. Review and update policies annually.

controls.name: Incident Handling
controls.description: Implement procedures for incident handling, including detection, response, analysis, and reporting.
controls.implementationGuidance: Establish incident management process. Define escalation paths. Implement 24/7 monitoring. Prepare incident notification procedures (24h early warning, 72h notification, 1 month final report).

controls.name: Business Continuity and Crisis Management
controls.description: Ensure business continuity and crisis management, including backup management, disaster recovery, and crisis management.
controls.implementationGuidance: Develop BCP and DRP. Implement backup and restoration. Define RTO/RPO. Establish crisis management team. Test plans annually.

controls.name: Supply Chain Security
controls.description: Ensure supply chain security including security-related aspects between each entity and its direct suppliers or service providers.
controls.implementationGuidance: Assess supplier security practices. Include security requirements in contracts. Monitor supplier risks. Audit critical suppliers.

controls.name: Security in Network and Information Systems Acquisition
controls.description: Ensure security in network and information systems acquisition, development, and maintenance, including vulnerability handling and disclosure.
controls.implementationGuidance: Integrate security into SDLC. Implement vulnerability management. Define vulnerability disclosure policy. Conduct security testing.

controls.name: Cybersecurity Risk Management Effectiveness Assessment
controls.description: Implement policies and procedures to assess the effectiveness of cybersecurity risk management measures.
controls.implementationGuidance: Conduct regular security audits. Perform penetration testing. Measure control effectiveness with KPIs. Report to management.

controls.name: Basic Cyber Hygiene and Cybersecurity Training
controls.description: Implement basic cyber hygiene practices and provide cybersecurity training.
controls.implementationGuidance: Implement patch management, password policies, least privilege. Conduct regular security awareness training. Train management body on cyber risks.

controls.name: Cryptography and Encryption Policies
controls.description: Implement policies and procedures regarding the use of cryptography and, where appropriate, encryption.
controls.implementationGuidance: Develop cryptography policy. Implement encryption at rest (AES-256) and in transit (TLS 1.2+). Establish key management procedures.

controls.name: Human Resources Security and Access Control
controls.description: Implement human resources security, access control policies, and asset management.
controls.implementationGuidance: Implement RBAC with least privilege. Background checks for critical roles. Onboard/offboard procedures. MFA for critical systems.

controls.name: Multi-Factor Authentication and Secure Communications
controls.description: Use of multi-factor authentication or continuous authentication, secured voice, video, and text communications.
controls.implementationGuidance: Deploy MFA across all critical systems. Implement secured emergency communication. Use encrypted channels for sensitive communications.

domains.name: Incident Reporting (Article 23)
domains.description: Requirements for reporting significant incidents to national authorities.

controls.name: Early Warning (24 hours)
controls.description: Submit an early warning to the CSIRT or competent authority within 24 hours of becoming aware of a significant incident.
controls.implementationGuidance: Establish 24-hour early warning procedures. Define what constitutes 'significant'. Prepare early warning template. Establish 24/7 reporting capability.

controls.name: Incident Notification (72 hours)
controls.description: Submit a detailed incident notification within 72 hours of becoming aware of a significant incident.
controls.implementationGuidance: Prepare detailed notification template. Include impact assessment, root cause (if known), and mitigation measures. Update early warning with details.

controls.name: Final Report (1 month)
controls.description: Submit a final report within one month of the incident notification, including root cause analysis and mitigation measures.
controls.implementationGuidance: Conduct root cause analysis. Document lessons learned. Describe remediation measures taken and planned. Include cross-border impact assessment.

domains.name: Governance and Accountability (Article 20)
domains.description: Management body responsibilities and personal accountability for cybersecurity.

controls.name: Management Body Approval
controls.description: Management bodies shall approve and oversee the implementation of cybersecurity risk management measures.
controls.implementationGuidance: Ensure board/management formally approves cybersecurity strategy. Document approval. Assign accountability. Include in governance reporting.

controls.name: Management Cybersecurity Training
controls.description: Members of the management body shall follow cybersecurity training to gain sufficient knowledge and skills.
controls.implementationGuidance: Provide regular cybersecurity training to all management body members. Cover risk landscape, regulatory obligations, and incident procedures.

breachNotification.timeframe: 24 hours early warning; 72 hours notification; 1 month final report
breachNotification.threshold: Significant incidents causing operational disruption or financial/reputational damage

penalties.essentialEntities: Up to €10,000,000 or 2% of global annual turnover
penalties.importantEntities: Up to €7,000,000 or 1.4% of global annual turnover
penalties.managementLiability: Individual managers can be held personally liable
